  • Merlion Park ‚Äì Iconic landmark with the half-fish, half-lion statue symbolizing Singapore.

  • Singapore Botanic Gardens (UNESCO World Heritage Site) ‚Äì Beautiful, free-entry gardens with a special Orchid Garden.
  • Singapore Zoo / Night Safari ‚Äì World-famous zoo with open enclosures and the unique nighttime safari experience.
  • MacRitchie Reservoir ‚Äì Hiking trails, treetop walk suspension bridge.
  • Pulau Ubin ‚Äì Rustic island where you can cycle through preserved nature and see Singapore‚Äôs past.

Cultural Sites

  • Chinatown ‚Äì Heritage temples, markets, and fantastic street food.
  • Little India ‚Äì Colorful streets, temples, and Indian food.
  • Kampong Glam (Arab Street) ‚Äì Beautiful Sultan Mosque, hipster cafes, and Middle Eastern shops.
  • National Museum of Singapore ‚Äì Learn about Singapore‚Äôs history in a modern, beautifully designed space.

Shopping & City Life

  • Orchard Road ‚Äì Massive shopping street with malls, luxury brands, and eateries.
  • Haji Lane ‚Äì Trendy alley with indie boutiques, colorful murals, and coffee shops.
  • Bugis Street ‚Äì Affordable shopping and local snacks.

Unique Experiences

  • Hawker Centres (like Lau Pa Sat, Maxwell Food Centre) ‚Äì Try local dishes like Hainanese chicken rice, laksa, chili crab, satay.
  • Clarke Quay ‚Äì Riverside nightlife, restaurants, bars, and river cruises.
  • Jewel Changi Airport ‚Äì Even if you‚Äôre not flying, the Rain Vortex (world‚Äôs tallest indoor waterfall) and lush garden are must-see.
